      • getInstance

      • messageReceived

        public void messageReceived(org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                   org.jboss.netty.channel.MessageEvent me)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is invoked with an upstream message event. If the message has one of the codes ACK or RESET it is most likely a response for a request waiting for a response. Thus the corresponding request is removed from the list of open requests and the request will not be retransmitted anymore.
        Overrides:
        messageReceived in class org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleChannelHandler
        Parameters:
        ctx - The ChannelHandlerContext
        me - The MessageEvent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • writeRequested

        public void writeRequested(org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                  org.jboss.netty.channel.MessageEvent me)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is invoked with a downstream message event. If it is a new message (i.e. to be transmitted the first time) of type CON , it is added to the list of open requests waiting for a response.
        Overrides:
        writeRequested in class org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleChannelHandler
        Parameters:
        ctx - The ChannelHandlerContext
        me - The MessageEvent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
